explanation: The function detect_cpu_core_count calls mhd_tool_get_system_cpu_count and mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count to determine CPU counts. To analyze if any code is dead under MISRA C Rule (no dead code), it's essential to understand the return values and behavior of these functions to see if their branches are ever executed or can be optimized away. The macro MHD_REAL_CPU_COUNT is also needed because its presence controls conditional compilation, affecting whether a block of code is included, potentially impacting dead code detection. Without these symbols, it is impossible to determine if any code paths in detect_cpu_core_count are never taken and thus dead code.
